table.description: Contains one row for each calibration parameter from each scan imported into this folder.

column.description: Contains the id of the scan.
Contains the name of the calibration parameter.
Contains the value of the calibration parameter.

table.description: Contains one row per feature identified in each MS1 features file imported into this folder.

column.description: Contains the unique id of the feature.
Contains the unique id of the file from which this feature was imported (see the Files table).
Contains the scan number during which the feature appeared at its highest intensity.
Contains the time offset (in seconds) at which the feature was detected.
Contains the mass-to-charge ratio for the identified feature.
Contains true when the m/z value came directly from a peak in the (centroided) source spectrum; false otherwise
Contains the calculated mass of the feature.
Contains the intensity of the feature.
Contains the estimated charge for the feature.
Contains the number of charge states in which the feature appeared.
Contains the Kullback-Leibler value, wich measures the similarity between the featureâ€™s peak pattern and the peaks expected from a peptide of that mass.
Contains the The (localized) running minima for intensity calculated across two dimensions (m/z and time (scan)).
Contains the difference between the median and the minima in the resampled data for the feature.
Contains the number of peaks in the feature.
Contains the first scan number in which the feature appeared.
Contains the last scan number in which the feature appeared.
Contains the number of scans in which the feature appeared.
The summed intensity (across the elution profile) of all deconvoluted peptides in the group.
Contains user-supplied comments about the feature.
Contains the scan number of the related MS2 scan found in an associated pep.xml file.
Contains a probability as to how certain the MS2 match is.
Contains the charge of the associated MS2 peptide.

table.description: Contains a list of MS1 data files that have been imported into this folder.

column.description: Contains the unique id of the data file.
Contains the unique id of the associated row in the exp.data table.
Contains the type of the file (1=features, 2=peaks).
Contains the full path to the source MzXML file from which this data file was produced.
Indicates whether the data flie was fully imported or not.
Indicates whether the data flie was deleted or not. Deleted files are kept in the database until an MS1 purge occurs.

table.description: Contains one row per peak family identified in each peaks xml file imported into this folder.

column.description: Contains the unique peak family id.
Contains the associated scan id.
Contains the monoisotopic mass-to-charge ratio for the peak family.
Contains the overall charge for the peak family.

table.description: Contains a row for each peak listed in every peaks xml file imported into this folder.

column.description: Contains the unique identifier for the peak.
Contains the unique id of the associated scan.
Contains the mass-to-charge ratio for the peak.
Contains the intensity for the peak.
Contains the area for the peak.
Contains the estimated error for the peak.
Contains the frequence for the peak.
Contains the phase of the peak.
The decay for the peak.

table.description: A many-to-many relation table between peaks and peak families.
Contains all scans found in all peaks xml files imported into this folder.

column.description: Contains the unique id for the scan.
Contains the unique id of the associated file.
Contains the scan number for the scan.
Contains the retention time (in seconds) for the scan.
Contains the duration of the scan.

table.description: Contains information about the software used to produce a given file. There will be one row in this table for each software package used to produce the file identified by the FileId column.

column.description: Contains the unique id of the software package.
Contains the unique id of the associated file.
Contains the name of the software package.
Contains the version number of the software package.
Contains the author of the software package.

table.description: Contains information about the parameters passed to a particular software package used to create a particular file. The SoftwareId column identifies the software package used to produce the file.

column.description: Contains the unique id of the associated software package.
Contains the name of the configuration parameter.
Contains the value of the configuration parameter.
